rules: Rule1: Supposing the legislation is implemented, then whenever the legislation is proposed, it is amended.
Rule2: In the event that the legislation is repealed, then assuming the legislation is proposed, it is amended.
Rule3: The food is inspected or the food is not regulated.
Rule4: The food is safe or it is not inspected.
Rule5: If the publication is peer-reviewed, then it is approved.
Rule6: Provided that the food is recalled, it is not withdrawn.
Rule7: Whenever the publication is published, it is distributed.
Rule8: Under the condition that the publication is distributed, then unless the negation of "if not factual then peer-reviewed" and lack of debate on legislation lead to the food being recalled.
Rule9: Provided that it is false that influential implies "if not factual then peer-reviewed," the legislation is proposed.
Rule10: If the legislation is neither implemented nor repealed, then the food is regulated.
Rule11: If it is not true that "not factual implies peer-reviewed" and non-controversial legislation lead to the legislation being revised.
Rule12: If the negation of "if not factual then peer-reviewed" and non-controversial legislation do not result in the legislation being revised.
Rule13: Under the condition that "not factual implies peer-reviewed" and non-debated legislation imply the food is not withdrawn.
Rule14: If it is not the case that "not factual implies peer-reviewed," then the legislation is controversial.
Rule15: Under the condition that "not factual implies peer-reviewed" is false, the legislation is debated.
facts: Fact3: The publication is not approved.
Fact4: The legislation is not amended.
Fact5: The food is not safe.
